attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls!
attributes.background:
Their is no need for the Severn bridge to have tolls! It is proven that they don't need it anymore. It makes 90 million and the mantence costs are 15 million...so where's the rest of the money going?! 

You don't pay to go to Scotland....so why do we have to pay to go to Wales.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 overall revenue from the tolls was over £90m, while it had been suggested that maintenance costs amounted to between £13m and £15m.

It would be a major boost for the Welsh ecomony, but it is getting held back from getting that vital boost.

attributes.action: Review funding into public services. Local authorities, NHS,police etc need help
attributes.background: Working in the public sector I have seen a decline in the last few years and knowing what future budgets hold I fear for communities. Had funding been correct over the years then there wouldn't be issues such as complaints on GP access or lack of bin collections etc
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence here is qualitative:
We all know someone who:

* Has struggled to see a doctor 
* Is homeless or can't get housing 
* Parents who scramble each year for a decent school place
* who is struggling to afford to eat
* works too many hours because they can't afford childcare 
* damaged a tyre due to pot holes in roads 
* Lack of landscaping 
* crime not responded too

attributes.action: Consider a Nationalised, funded Mental Health First Response Service.
attributes.background: UK Police Forces and NHS services now spend around 30% of their time responding to Mental Health sufferers who do not receive the best attention or assistance. A MH Service that are the first responders to Suicide risks and Sectioning requests, who can convey MH Patients to the correct facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Working in the Police, it is being increasingly more and more difficult to tackle Crime and deal with Community issues, when every 3 or 4 of 10 incidents we are responding to are for Mental Health patients that require specialised help that we cannot provide. 
This is tying up Emergency resourcing that can be better used elsewhere, and would provide MH patients with the best care and help possible.
Sectioning people and attending Suicide Risks would be better dealt by more a appropriate agency

attributes.action: Set a time limit of 2 weeks on JSA and ESA decisions to reduce claimants' stress
attributes.background: The film "I, Daniel Blake" gave a vivid and true-to-life description of the possible consequences of long delays waiting for official decisions from the Job Centre et al. The system appears designed to grind down claimants, and cause the greatest hardship. The current system is cruel and degrading.

attributes.action: Make Marcus Jones review his choice to turn down the funding for mk homeless
attributes.background: Over the last year we have had three of our homeless die on the streets.. There are also people living in  Substandard temporary accommodation in and out of the city. Please review your decision to turn down funding that would of helped these people the government have forgotten
attributes.additional_details:
We have over 500 family's that are homeless... This money would of helped the local authority to provide 50 units to help home these people the gvmt have forgotten... 
People are dying on our streets.. 
Marcus Jones please fully review your decision. 
And give us an answer as to why you turned down the application! 

Thank you

attributes.action: Change the way Tax Credits are calculated to stop overpayments
attributes.background:
Tax credits are state benefits that provide extra money to people responsible for children, disabled workers and other workers on lower incomes.
Have you ever had an over payment for Tax Credits even though you advised them straight away of your change of circumstances as they asked? read on..
attributes.additional_details:
Have you ever received an over payment for Tax Credits?
This is because HMRC calculate your entitlement over a 12 month period they predict that your situation will remain the same for these 12 months, so if you then change your circumstances more than likely you will get an over payment usually in the £100's.
I suggest they calculate it weekly or monthly and remain the same each week/month unless we advise them of any changes and hopefully see over payments £10-30 instead of putting us in debt.

attributes.action: Pass a law that does what the Children & Young Persons Act 1933 is meant to do.
attributes.background: The Children & Young Persons Act 1933 says it is illegal for a child who is younger than 13, to assist in a non-performance trade or occupation carried on for profit. In many cases such as in research this law is not enforced. Therefore a fully enforceable law is needed.
attributes.additional_details: Hundreds of thousands of children younger than 13 are employed in the UK in commercial research, testing, marketing and consultancy (ISBN1845298802). Child Employment Officers do not give them the protection they give children in performance work such as modelling & acting. Irrespective of the above Act the Officers do not regard them as being employed (NNCEE). This, and the lack of protection, undermines their rights as workers, and can result in them being mistreated & deprived of pay (ACAS).

attributes.action: Start making Gazumping Illegal.
attributes.background: We put in an offer for a House about 3 weeks ago it got accepted. Mortgage approved everything. Then Tuesday 1st November 2016 got told that someone put in a Higher  offer and that got accepted. So now left High and Dry.
attributes.additional_details: We don't want this happening to other people

attributes.action: Stop all ivory trade from the UK and press for bans globally
attributes.background: Ivory collected after 1947 is currently illegal globally, however, Britain still exports legal Ivory to many countries such as Hong Kong, this  contributes greatly to the Ivory trade and can help salesmen conceal their illegal imports from across Africa, drastically harming elephant populations.

attributes.action: Ban the use of loud fireworks in residential areas
attributes.background: Many animals find fireworks scary. It is estimated that 45 per cent of dogs and other animals in the UK show signs of fear when they hear fireworks (RSPCA). This can include toileting indoors, shaking, barking and crying. Fireworks should not be used in a residential area to avoid animal distress.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks should not be allowed in residential areas, and should only be allowed in a licensed settings on set days, not days or weeks before/after the event.

attributes.action: Change Religious Education to Religious and Cultural Studies
attributes.background: Students should be taught more than just basic religious principles. Teaching children about other races and cultures will help stamp out racism in our ever-progressing and diverse society.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the biggest cities in the UK (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol and Cardiff) are among the most diverse in Europe. Our youth should be accepting of their peers whatever their heritage, especially in the wake of Brexit and the rising level of hate crime.

attributes.action: Ban the use of driverless cars before it's too late.
attributes.background: They are danger to other road users. An absurd idea and will cause the death of many pedestrians that could of been avoided. If you don't want to drive then get a taxi. They are not safe for anyone other than the passenger.

attributes.action:
Petition
Allow farmers to grow hemp without restriction.
attributes.background: Remove all restrictions on growing industrial hemp. Although the industrial strains of the plant have no psychoactive potential, the absurd level of control has effectively destroyed its value as an agricultural crop. The fibres , the oils , plastics- endless possibilities all natural
attributes.additional_details: Bees on the endangered species list - kind of important due to pollination - bees love hemp..

attributes.action: Force the government to raise the threshold of inheritance tax to £1,000,000.
attributes.background: Current threshold for inheritance tax is £325,000. After that a 40% rate is applied.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/housepriceindex/2015-04-14

https://www.gov.uk/inheritance-tax/overview

attributes.action: A law that Family Courts factor evidence of Alienation Inducement in its ruling
attributes.background: Children being alienated from one parent by another is common in Family Court contact requests or custody cases. This is psychologically harmful to the child and prolongs the court process unnecessarily. There are many papers about Alienation Inducement and the consequent Parent Alienation Syndrome

attributes.action: Entirely ban the use of BPA for the packaging of any product sold in UK
attributes.background:
BPA stands for bisphenol A. It is found in plastics that are used in containers that store food and beverages like water bottles. 
Exposure to BPA is a concern because of health effects on the brain, behavior and prostate gland of fetuses, infants & children. Also links to infertility & cancer
attributes.additional_details:
Additional research suggests a possible link between BPA and increased blood pressure , cancer, infertility and birth defects.

http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/221205.php

The human experiment - documentary that can be found on Netflix / you tube

attributes.action: Reform the use and duration of Pre-Charge Bail
attributes.background: The current use of Pre-Charge Bail is unacceptable. Firstly, restrictions are imposed upon individuals who have not been charged with a crime, and imposed without evidence. Secondly, there is no maximum duration for this imposition, therefore suspects can be held in legal limbo for years.
attributes.additional_details:
What is Pre-Charge Bail?
Pre-charge bail is a legal loophole in which an individual who has been arrested, but not charged, can be placed on bail while police gather evidence. 

Prime Minister (then Home Secretary) Theresa May has said:
"I have been clear that it is simply not acceptable for individuals to spend months and in some cases years on pre-charge bail, with no system of review, only for charges never to be brought against them."

attributes.action: Force social media to verify its members more throughly to help stop bullying.
attributes.background: Bullying on social media is out of control. It's so easy for someone to say hurtful things, to someone else online that would otherwise been deemed unacceptable in person. These comments are demoralising, hurtful and depressing and are often said without any thoughts of the person they're aimed at.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media needs to offer more protection, help and support to its young, old, vulnerable and genuine members. Banning a troll member is not enough, as they can easily setup another account with a email address and start trolling again. 
Social media needs to verify new members more throughly with debt / credit or electoral register info and ban for life those intent on causing harm to others. Encourage members to take more responsibility for their comments by showing they are a real person.

attributes.action: I want you to to make it law that all Cats & Kittens to be microchipped.
attributes.background: With so many Cats being killed in road traffic accidents, then being discarded by most councils as waste. Many people want to know what has happened to their pet, whether killed in a road accident or lost.

attributes.action: Review VED switch to mileage based tax system
attributes.background: For years we have been paying road tax on a fixed rate system. This is old out dated. Punishing those who barely use the roads while those who abuse them barley cover the damage they cause.
attributes.additional_details: Allowing those who do extreme amounts of mileage to pay the same rate as those who barely use the road is unfair. I personally fall into both catagories. I do approx 50k a year for work and less than 2k in my own personal vehicle. Yet i pay more tax for my personal vehicle than my company does for the vehicle doing x25 the mileage. monitor fuel usage when you register a car. You get a fuel card u swipe everytime you fill up (similar to a company fuel card) to prevent tampering. No card no fuel.

attributes.action: Government to introduce clause to declassify first class on trains at peak times
attributes.background: During peak / commuter hours, many trains are running at capacity except for the first class areas, which are often empty. This is forcing people to stand when they could be sitting in comfort and therefore having a more enjoyable commute to work.
attributes.additional_details: As the government is responsible for issuing the franchises to companies to run trains on the railways, I am calling for a clause to be added at the time of renewals for first class to be de classified during peak hours or on commuter trains. Unlike the intercity trains, there are no real benefits from having first class (i.e no refreshment service) and the seats are often no different. These seats could be used by more people and offer value for money when prices are  increasing annually.

attributes.action: Stop married personnel paying for own home and camp accommodation
attributes.background: Currently the army charges married personnel for camp accommodation if they own a permenant family home until they over the age of 37
attributes.additional_details: I'm currently serving in the British Army attached to the Navy, as I bought my own home I have to commute every weekend. Within the navy married personnel who own and live in a house do not require to pay for camp accommodation. But Army policy you have to pay for accommodation until you are 37 which I believe is unfair.  As the reason why serving members need the accommodation is to allow them a place to sleep and administrate whilst away from their personal home.

attributes.action: Delay Article 50 until the policy of the US towards Russia and NATO is clearer
attributes.background: A strong European Union is essential if stronger ties between the US and Russia are formed and US support for NATO is reduced. Triggering Article 50 before US policy becomes clear could be highly detrimental to the stability of all European countries including the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/feb/09/brexit-trump-britain-national-security-article-50

attributes.action: Funds to support community fridge's around the U.K.
attributes.background:
To have community fridges available to help homeless and people on low income or unemployed. 

Allow businesses and public to donate unwanted food into community fridges to help people who can't afford or struggling to feed family.

attributes.action: Charge for GP apptments. Allow GP's to dispense low cost drugs such as aspirin.
attributes.background:
A small charge for visit to GP would deter time wasters & release funds for deserving needs. 
GP's prescribe aspirin and similar drugs costing a few pence which incur standard £10-£12 "Pharmacy handling" charge to the Dept of Health. Curb this waste too and spend on more deserving needs
attributes.additional_details:
From data in the public domain it is evident that many patients fail to attend appointments with virtually no financial penalty. A £5-£10 per person per appointment (with some exceptions) is affordable by the majority of inhabitants.
Prescriptions for low cost (normally over the counter) drugs incur significant "handling" charge. By permitting/instructing GP's to dispense such items the savings can be diverted/used to benefit more urgent demands on the Health Service.

attributes.action: Prevent Xi Jinping from making any State Visits to the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Xi Jinping should not be allowed to enter the UK in his capacity as head of the Chinese government due to the Chinese communist parties prolific violation of human rights.
attributes.additional_details: Since Xi Jinping became President of the People's Republic of China (PRC) in March 2013, the human rights group CHRD has documented more than 1,800 cases of arbitrary detention and torture of human rights activists and lawyers.

attributes.action: Assaults on emergency personnel the same penalty as assaulting a police officer
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services are being assaulted. This should not be tolerated and should be felt with as severely as Assaulting a Police Officer. This type of abuse must be severely dealt with.
attributes.additional_details: Having known personnel in the emergency service and hearing they are abused nearly everyday.  We have a duty to support them like they do us, when we need them to save our lives.

attributes.action: Fine people who smoke on hospital grounds or have security to escort them out!
attributes.background: I not only work in the nhs and see this on a daily basis .But I now have a 12 day old baby born at 25 weeks fighting for her life. And where people smoke in the hospital grounds the ward she is on is right above where everyone smokes and it travels right to her window! I've argued many times with
attributes.additional_details: The inconsiderate people smoking out the entrance of the ward. But they do not care and do not move as they know there is no one there to stop them! You can smell the smoke all through the corridor of the hospitals entrances . And other staff members don't even think to question the people doing it.They even sit in the wheel chairs outside smoking .Do the wheelchairs even get cleaned for when the porter needs it for the next patient? The signs are not enough !! This is at st Georges hospital.

attributes.action: Urge Broadband Companies to change old aluminium wires to copper for fibre optic
attributes.background: I have an old aluminium line that goes a fair distance which causes a lot of drop off in the connection, as aluminium is a worse conductor in comparison to copper. Households across England get offered broadband packages that connection lines cannot deliver due to old forgotten aluminium cables.
attributes.additional_details: I live in Milton Keynes, in an area called two mile ash where aluminium is used, I am fairly far away from the cabinet I’m connected to which causes me to get a max connection of 10.5Mbps download and 1Mbps upload. Houses further than me experience a worse drop off rate however an area near me called Emerson valley, where they've used copper can reach speeds of 54Mbps download and 13Mbps upload copper makes a big difference and should be the standard for a modern faster England.

attributes.action: Penalties for those who park in parent-toddler spaces without children
attributes.background: As a father of two children and a driver, I find it hugely ignorant of those who find it acceptable to park in parent-toddler spaces when they do not have children. There are penalities for parking in a disabled space incorrectly so why not the same for parent-toddler spaces?

attributes.action: Give the British public a referendum on cutting foreign aid. Give it to the NHS
attributes.background:
An overwhelming 78 per cent of voters want cuts to Britain’s wasteful £12.4 billion annual aid budget, and the money diverted to the Health Service instead. 
If a tenth of the aid budget was diverted to the NHS, the £1.24 billion would pay for around three million stays in a hospital bed.

attributes.action: I want to lower the abortion limit
attributes.background: A baby is a baby from conception but more so knowing it's got a heartbeat at 6-7 weeks. 24 weeks a baby is developed it can survive. I don't agree that a baby can be born before 24 weeks and they won't save it but as soon as it's over 24 weeks they will fight to save the baby.
attributes.additional_details: The abortion limit needs to be lowered to below 12 weeks!!

attributes.action: Speed up DBS checks
attributes.background: Care companies are in crisis due to the waiting time for DBS checks. Staff only have to give a months notice to leave  but to get new staff to cover them can take months, It is hard enough getting staff to work in the care industry and many give up the wait after 4 weeks as need to be in paid work.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all companies to recycle
attributes.background: Currently companies including large multinational ones such as macdonalds, cineworld and other industrial companies use plenty of material that is recyclable. However I have noticed that most don't offer the option to do so and most of this material ends up in landfill.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies open to the public should provide recycling stations where the discarded items can be separated into recyclable and non-recyclable waste. 
All businesses should manage their waste into these categories to help protect the environment for all life on earth.

attributes.action: Divert 50% of the foreign aid budget to tackle social care for the aged in uk
attributes.background: More councils in the uk are short of funds to tackle social care in the UK.(12 billion foreign aid budget wasted on rogue nations/state officials), to go directly to councils, so that they do not in turn raise their taxes, which are currently too high now.
attributes.additional_details: This will help to pay for more care homes and after care for the elderly and release more beds in hospitals so that we can all benefit. With an ageing population, If this situation is not tackled this way, then bigger problems will arise. It is on best affordable way forward to this and still retains 50% of the foreign aid budget, which should be more scrutinised than currently is or scrapped altogether.

attributes.action: To make a ban on eating disorder websites or videos as this destroys lives.
attributes.background: This is something that effects me. I think that promoting the way doing eating disorders is disgusting and should be a crime as it affects lives. I have seen all these websites where they tell best was to purge (throwing up food). This is horrible and needs to stop as this is killing people.
attributes.additional_details: The are many horrible web sites like these that need to be banned as they are destroying lives and families. Please help me stop these horrible websites as they are messing peoples lives.

attributes.action: Introduce a phased ban on multiple point fishing hooks for all leisure angling
attributes.background: For future generations, the welfare and conservation of all native fish species will benefit from a phased UK ban on multiple point hooks for all leisure (sea, coarse and game) angling. This petition proposes to change government policy, restricting anglers to using one single fishing hook per rod.
attributes.additional_details: Leisure angling is one of our biggest recreational pastimes. Whether as a requirement or personal preference, fish should be returned to the water quickly and unharmed. Whilst conservation measures, including a ban on lead weights, help to protect native fish and other wildlife, leisure angling’s use of multiple point hooks remains its Achilles heel. Removal is more time consuming, increases fish stress and the likelihood of harm or death. There are no grounds for defending multiple point hooks.

attributes.action: Compulsory for all non UK residents/visitors to have Gov't run comp medical ins
attributes.background: I've just read about the NHS being £30m in debt to medical tourism and this is isn't the first time I've read about the strain on the NHS from non residents coming here for the maternity/cancer/medical care.Gov needs to operate a scheme for all visitors to have comp care cover before admittance
attributes.additional_details: Please see 120 individual NHS Trust accounts for the amount owed individually for medical tourism.

attributes.action: Make Personal Development classes part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Sources suggest that on average, children spend just under 800 hours in a classroom each year! During this time a range of subjects will be taught and skills will be gained. However, in the midst of Maths, Science, PE and others, when do you hear kids shouting "I'm off to Personal Development Class"
attributes.additional_details:
I do not have an issue with the standard of education our children get, but I want them to have an opportunity each week to work on Developing themselves, to learn and build on attributes such as Resilience, Self Motivation and Empathy to name a few. 

“A teacher has two jobs: fill young minds with knowledge, yes, but more important, give those minds a compass so that that knowledge doesn't go to waste.” - Mr Hollands Opus 1995 (movie)

attributes.action: Legalize the medicinal use and sale of Cannabis via prescription.
attributes.background:
Millions of people throughout the world and in the UK suffer from conditions of which Cannabis offers a significant and harmless relief. 
To name a few:
-Glaucoma
-Seizures (Dravet's syndrome)
-Alzheimer's Disease
-Multiple Sclerosis
-Arthritis
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.who.int/medicines/access/controlled-substances/6_2_cannabis_update.pdf

http://www.encod.org/info/700-MEDICINAL-USES-OF-CANNABIS.html

attributes.action: Diwali is Hindu festival and for lot of Hindu it is also their New year as well.
attributes.background: If Diwali is made as a National Holiday like Christmas then it will save Hindu people to use their holiday

attributes.action: Stop Network Rail removing lineside trees for their own commercial gain.
attributes.background: Recently a residential area within Stirling received generic letters for Network Rail advising that from 26th November 2016 they were going to be removing trees and plants from their lineside. They advised this was to minimise the risk of disrupting railway operations.
attributes.additional_details: This proposed action is completely unjustified and un-proportionate. They have not considered the impact on the environment, wildlife and the effect it will have for local residents. The letter states that they will be removing trees,plants and vegetation unto 10 meters from their lineside, this will in effect create a concrete jungle and damage the beautiful aesthetics of Stirling. This must be opposed and stopped as the impact of this is far greater than the commercial gain of a company.

attributes.action: Redirect the estate of those who die intestate from Prince Charles to the NHS.
attributes.background: Currently Prince Charles receives the estate of those dying intestate (without a will or any relevant surviving relatives) in Cornwall. This petition requests the law is changed so that money is given to the NHS rather than to the prince.

attributes.action: Provide New Zealand with aid to help them rebuild after the earthquake.
attributes.background: In light of the two earthquakes that have just hit the New Zealand south island on 13th Nov, the British Government should provide aid to assist the government and people of New Zealand to rebuild their infrastructure. The money should come from the overseas aid budget

attributes.action: Bring 'Hands-on' STEM Back to Schools
attributes.background: As a STEM Educator and STEM Charity Owner, a important issue has come to light, that a lot of 'Hands-on' STEM skills have been stripped from young people's STEM education, leading to a large skill short-fall when student's carry on studying STEM subjects at university.
attributes.additional_details: Information about this subject has been collected and analysed by volunteers at GlamSci (www.GlamSci.org) whom are a non-profit STEM educational charity concerned with young people's education and rights to STEM subjects. This view is backed by current educational figures gathered by STEM governing bodies, universities and other educational organisations.

attributes.action: Prevent companies from defaulting the 'save payment information' on a website
attributes.background: Typically when purchasing online goods, companies by default check the 'Save these payment details'. Saving payment details online isn't a good thing and whilst the option should be there, it shouldn't be defaulted. This should be addressed and could potentially save people from fraudulent purchases
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was the victim of fraud as I may have mistakenly saved my payment card details on a website that was later compromised.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close St Bart's Hospital, Rochester, Kent.
attributes.background: There is a lack of provisions in the Medway Towns as it is and we need this hospital. It was used as a rehab hospital for stroke patients and anyone else who needed a longer stay in the hospital. Medway Maritime Hospital will only allow people to stay short term as they need the beds.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a brief history of the hospital; this is one of the oldest hospitals in Britain, having been founded in 1078 by Gundulph, Bishop of Rochester, for the "poor and leprous". The current hospital building in New Road, Rochester was built in 1861.  The hospital relied on charity donations until 1948 when it was funded by the NHS.

We don't want this historic building to end up in the wrong hands because they may demolish this gothic style building and a piece of Medway history will be gone!

attributes.action: Make it Law for drivers involved in a accident to report to police at the scene
attributes.background: Drivers are able to leave the scene of an accident and be within the law to report it within 24 hours, therefore police are unable to take correct alcohol and drug samples, giving a possible lighter sentence.
attributes.additional_details: Ben regan was killed by a driver who failed to stop and drove home and hid the car, and called the police 10 hours after, to plead not guilty to a careless driving charge due to lack of evidence. Family's are being put through hell because of this loophole. It must be stopped.

attributes.action: Ensure that in future 65% of eligible voters are required to pass a referendum.
attributes.background: For changes that would have a profound effect on the nation its constitution and its people a clear 65% of eligible voters should be the mark so there can be no doubt as to the legitimacy of the vote. In addition Parliament should be legally obliged to honour any passed referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Previous referendums are held at the first past 50% of those that voted is all that is needed to carry a referendum this could be seen as undemocratic as it is not based on the eligible voting public. Also allowing such tight voting margins can be seen to be a cause of civil unrest.

attributes.action: Make it an arrest-able offence for protesters to obstruct roads of any kind
attributes.background: As people are aware protesters come in all different forms and from different beliefs. For those who chose to protest in roads whether it be a side road, entrance to a work sight, or a main road. This is petition is to help make it an arrest-able offence to block roads of any kind.
attributes.additional_details:
Helping stop protesters obstructing roads and access of the road; by making it an arrest-able offence to cause obstruction or disruption too any road of any kind.
This could help prevent companies suing or losing business and increase awareness for road safety and the dangers of protesters using main roads or side roads of any kind.
